abstracts.cdata!:
The project loan was cancelled on
            September 23, 1998 upon the Borrower's request. In
            consideration to the passage of controversial legislation,
            regarding the powers of the National Judicial Council,
            namely, that the statute in question had restricted the
            National Judicial Council's powers in disciplinary
            matters, consequently, the achievement of a critical project
            objective was unlikely, as stated in the Policy Letter, the
            Bank granted an effectiveness extension on March 16, 1998.
            However, potential instability risks had been identified
            during project preparation, since effective Judiciary needs
            to ensure impartiality, and credibility of judicial
            decisions. Lessons mainly address the timing for project
            preparation, i.e., the "emergency period" of the
            Peruvian Judiciary, an issue which weakened institutions,
            depriving same of any autonomy, or judicial participation in
            the reform process. Although the loan was never effective,
            this assessment of the emergency period, provide guidance
            for sector interventions in Peru.
